1.text: Peel the label off of a can of sweetened condensed milk.

2.text: Place the can in a pot and cover it with water.

3.text: Bring the water to a boil over high heat.

4.text: Let it simmer for 2-3 hours on a low flame.

5.text: Use tongs to remove the can from the water.

6.text: Let the can cool completely before opening it.

7.text: Store the sealed can at room temperature for up to 3 months.

8.text: Pour condensed milk into an 8 in (20 cm) x 8 in (20 cm) baking dish.

9.text: Cover the baking dish with tin foil.

10.text: Place the baking dish inside a larger baking dish.

11.text: Add water until it reaches ¾ the height of the smaller dish.

12.text: Bake the milk at 425 °F (218 °C) for 90 minutes.

13.text: Remove the dishes from the oven and stir the milk.

14.text: Refrigerate the dulce de leche for up to 3 weeks.

15.text: Pour 1 quart (0.9 liters) of whole milk into a pot.

17.text: Stir the mixture over a medium flame.

18.text: Let the milk boil for 90 to 120 minutes, stirring regularly.

19.text: Remove the pot from the heat and let the mixture cool.

20.text: Pour the mixture into an airtight jar and refrigerate for up to 3 weeks.
